item.title: 丰田推迟350亿美元交易截止期限，该交易遭埃利奥特反对
item.description: 丰田集团延长了其关键部门私有化竞标的投标期限，这表明这家日本企业集团需要更多时间来争取股东支持，以应对埃利奥特投资管理公司阻挠该交易的强力推动。【原文：The Toyota group extended the tender period for its bid to privatize a key unit, signaling the Japanese conglomerate needs more time to rally shareholder support in the face of an aggressive push by Elliott Investment Management to block the deal.】

item.title: 据Counterpoint数据显示，iPhone 17在1月逆势突破中国移动销售疲软局面
item.description: 据Counterpoint Research数据显示，苹果公司的iPhone是1月份在中国市场实现销售增长的唯一智能手机品牌。【原文：Apple Inc.’s iPhone was the only smartphone line to register growth in China sales in January, according to Counterpoint Research.】

item.title: 拍卖规则放宽后，外国投资者蜂拥购买赞比亚债券
item.description: 随着资金从美元计价资产转向高收益投资，在赞比亚政府取消非居民参与债务拍卖的限制后，外国投资者纷纷涌入该国本地债券市场。【原文：Foreigners have piled into Zambia’s local bond market following the government’s move to lift a cap on non-resident participation in debt auctions, as money shifts from dollar-denominated assets into higher-yielding investments.】

item.title: 印度农民抗议莫迪与特朗普签署的贸易协议
item.description: 印度各地数千名农民即将聚集，发起大规模抗议活动，反对该国与美国达成的这项期待已久的贸易协议。组织者称，该协议可能为进口商品铺平道路，从而损害国内农业。【原文：Thousands of farmers across India are set to gather for large-scale protests against the country’s long-awaited trade deal with the United States, an agreement that organizers say could pave the way for imports that will hurt domestic agriculture.】

item.title: 联想销售额因人工智能和抢购内存产品而提升
item.description: 联想集团有限公司公布的销售额超出预期，这得益于消费者在预期内存芯片价格上涨前抢购个人电脑，以及其人工智能服务器的强劲势头。【原文：Lenovo Group Ltd. reported better-than-expected sales, helped by consumers buying PCs ahead of anticipated memory chip price hikes as well as strong momentum for its AI servers.】

item.title: 阿根廷参议院通过米莱劳工改革案，迈出关键第一步
item.description: 阿根廷参议员于周四凌晨通过了总统哈维尔·米莱标志性的劳动改革法案，这是这位自由主义者雄心勃勃议程的关键进展，有望助力其政府重返国际市场。【原文：Senators in Argentina passed President Javier Milei’s signature labor reform bill early Thursday, a key step forward for the libertarian’s ambitious agenda that could support his government’s return to international markets.】

item.title: 应用材料公司将支付2.525亿美元以了结美国调查
item.description: 应用材料公司将支付2.525亿美元，以了结美国商务部对其向中国不当出口设备的调查，为这家美国最大的芯片制造设备供应商长达数年的风波画上句号。【原文：Applied Materials Inc. will pay $252.5 million to settle a US Commerce Department investigation into improper exports to China, ending a yearslong saga for the largest American supplier of chipmaking machinery.】

item.title: 据称因投资者反对 清街公司考虑缩减IPO规模
item.description: 据知情人士透露，清街集团正考虑缩减首次公开募股的规模及价格区间。【原文：Clear Street Group Inc. is considering reducing the size and price range of its initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 柬埔寨出台新法严打诈骗农场犯罪团伙
item.description: 柬埔寨正在起草一项针对网络诈骗的法律，旨在建立一道防线，阻止犯罪分子利用该国作为基地，从全球受害者手中骗取数十亿美元。【原文：Cambodia is drafting a law targeting online scams, seeking to build a bulwark against criminals using the country as a base to siphon billions of dollars from victims globally.】

item.title: 比特币、科技巨头与人工智能交易过山车
item.description:
本期播客聚焦：科技股与加密货币为何承压。

【原文：

On this week’s podcast: why tech stocks and crypto are under pressure.

】

item.title: 铜价上涨，金属市场因需求前景及美元走势延续涨势
item.description: 铜价延续涨势，得益于供应前景趋紧及美元走软，尽管中国买家在农历新年假期前采购意愿减弱。【原文：Copper extended gains, buoyed by a tighter supply outlook and a weakening dollar, even as Chinese buying waned ahead of the Lunar New Year break.】

item.title: SBI时隔15年首次在市值上超越TCS
item.description: 投资者正转向投资国内业务为主的企业。【原文：Investors are rotating into domestically focused names.】

item.title: 大豆价格触及两个月高点，因中美停火期延长引发乐观情绪
item.description: 美国大豆期货触及两个月高点，此前有关中美可能延长贸易休战的报道提振了市场对美国农产品将获得更多采购的预期。【原文：US soybean futures hit their highest in two months after a report on a potential extended trade truce between the US and China fueled hopes for additional purchases of American agricultural products.】

item.title: 日本外汇部门负责人称日元升值后仍保持高度警惕
item.description: 日本货币事务最高官员表示，在日元汇率持续走强的一周里，政府对外汇市场动向保持高度警惕。【原文：Japan’s top currency official said the government remains on high alert over foreign exchange movements in a week that’s seen gains in the Japanese currency.】

item.title: 对冲基金转而看涨日元，即便美国就业数据强劲
item.description: 交易员表示，尽管强劲的美国就业数据抑制了市场对美联储今年降息的预期，但随着买入日本的交易策略逐渐显效，对冲基金正逆势而为，加大押注日元走强的力度。【原文：Hedge funds are reversing course and ramping up bets on a stronger yen as the buy Japan trade takes hold even after robust US jobs data curbed expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts this year, according to traders.】

item.title: WhatsApp称俄罗斯曾试图封锁其消息服务
item.description: WhatsApp表示，俄罗斯政府已采取行动在该国"全面封锁"其广受欢迎的加密通讯服务，此举旨在推动用户转向使用一款由国家支持的新应用程序。【原文：WhatsApp said Russia’s government has moved to “fully block” its popular encrypted messaging service in the country as part of an effort to drive adoption of a new, state-sponsored app.】

item.title: 美国贸易协议为印度可再生能源股抛出救命稻草
item.description: 在特朗普总统与印度达成意外贸易协议后，印度可再生能源股正开始摆脱落后者的地位。【原文：India’s renewable energy stocks are starting to shake off their status as stragglers after President Donald Trump’s surprise trade deal with the nation.】

item.title: 日本超长期债券延续涨势，因财政担忧缓解
item.description: 日本超长期债券延续了大选后的涨势，首相高市早苗创纪录的选举胜利缓解了投资者对财政政策的担忧。【原文：Japan’s super-long bonds extended their post-election rally as Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s historic election win soothed investor concerns about fiscal policy.】

item.title: 印尼债券收益率飙升，成为债券投资者的短期押注目标
item.description: 在MSCI公司和穆迪评级机构的双重打击后，印尼当局正努力稳定市场，部分投资者认为当地债券具有短期价值。【原文：As Indonesian authorities seek to stabilize markets after the double blow from MSCI Inc. and Moody’s Ratings, some investors see short-term value in local bonds.】

item.title: 燃料批发商Arko Petroleum在美国IPO中筹集2亿美元
item.description: 便利店企业Arko Corp.旗下的燃料批发子公司Arko Petroleum Corp.通过扩大规模的首次公开募股筹集了2亿美元，发行价处于市场预估区间的下限。【原文：Arko Petroleum Corp., the fuel wholesaler subsidiary of convenience store firm Arko Corp., raised $200 million in an upsized initial public offering that priced at the bottom of a marketed range.】

item.title: 安联集团股价创2003年以来最大跌幅，全年业绩未达预期
item.description: 总部位于悉尼的AMP有限公司（业务涵盖财富管理与退休储蓄）因全年利润未达预期，股价创下逾二十年来最大跌幅。【原文：AMP Ltd., the Sydney-based firm that spans wealth management and retirement savings, sank the most in more than two decades after full-year profits missed expectations.】

item.title: Founders Fund、D.E. Shaw、Dragoneer领投Anthropic融资
item.description: 知情人士透露，Anthropic正接近完成一笔融资交易，此轮融资规模超过200亿美元，由包括彼得·蒂尔的创始人基金、德华投资公司和Dragoneer投资集团在内的投资者联合领投。这笔融资使这家人工智能公司获得的投资方阵容进一步扩大，也成为有史以来规模最大的初创企业融资之一。【原文：Anthropic is nearing the completion of a deal to raise more than $20 billion in a funding round co-led by investors including Peter Thiel’s Founders Fund, D.E. Shaw & Co. and Dragoneer Investment Group, according to people familiar with the matter — adding to the artificial intelligence company’s roster of backers in one of the largest startup funding rounds ever.】

item.title: 清街公司首次公开募股据称因估值问题遭遇投资者抵制
item.description: 据知情人士透露，在周四预期定价前，Clear Street Group Inc.的首次公开募股因目标估值问题正面临投资者抵制。【原文：Clear Street Group Inc.’s initial public offering is facing investor pushback on its targeted valuation ahead of the expected pricing Thursday, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 资生堂财报超预期，股价创近8年来最大涨幅
item.description: 资生堂公司股价创近八年最大涨幅，此前该公司公布的第四季度财报及全年业绩预期均超出分析师预期。【原文：Shiseido Co. rose the most in nearly eight years after the company’s fourth quarter earnings and full-year forecast beat analyst estimates.】

item.title: 印度CPI改革或为央行按兵不动提供理由
item.description: 印度将于周四公布基于新指数的通胀数据，分析师称该数据可能显示经济中存在较高的价格压力，这将使央行有理由维持利率不变。【原文：India will publish inflation figures based on a new index on Thursday, which analysts say may show elevated price pressures in the economy, giving the central bank reason to keep interest rates on hold.】

item.title: 日本投资者仍担忧高市早苗将引发新一轮崩盘
item.description: 日本首相高市早苗以压倒性优势赢得选举后，投资者初期反应普遍积极。但他们仍对她扩张性支出计划可能引发的另一轮市场崩盘保持警惕。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s landslide election win saw a largely positive initial response from investors. But they remain wary of another market meltdown over her expansive spending plans.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行行长称若通胀持续顽固将考虑再度加息
item.description: 澳大利亚央行行长米歇尔·布洛克表示，若通胀持续居高不下，央行已做好进一步加息的准备。她同时强调，央行董事会仍持谨慎态度，尚未决定是否需要进一步收紧货币政策。【原文：Australia’s central bank stands ready to raise interest rates further if inflation proves persistent, Governor Michele Bullock said, stressing that the board remains cautious and is yet to decide whether further tightening is warranted.】

item.title: 蓝猫楔形堆栈以21亿美元贷款助推人工智能债务热潮
item.description: 据知情人士透露，蓝猫资本旗下的数据中心公司Stack Infrastructure Inc.正寻求约30亿澳元（合21亿美元）的贷款，以加速在澳大利亚的开发进程，满足人工智能和云服务激增的需求。【原文：Blue Owl Capital-owned data center company Stack Infrastructure Inc. is seeking a loan of around A$3 billion ($2.1 billion), according to people familiar with the matter, as it accelerates development in Australia to meet surging demand for artificial intelligence and cloud services.】

item.title: 伦敦房价跌势将触底，皇家特许测量师学会调查显示
item.description: 一项周四公布的调查显示，房地产经纪人首次预测伦敦房价将上涨，这是逾一年来首次出现此类预期。【原文：For the first time in more than a year, property agents expect house prices to rise in London, a survey revealed Thursday.】

item.title: 橡树资本在特殊情况基金首次关闭时创纪录地筹集了24亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，橡树资本管理公司已为其最新设立的专注于企业特殊状况的基金获得24亿美元的认购承诺，创下该策略的最高纪录。【原文：Oaktree Capital Management LP has secured $2.4 billion in commitments for its latest fund focused on corporate special situations, according to people familiar with the matter, setting a firm record for that strategy.】
